description: Dynamic pricing assistant holds premium SKU price steady despite competitor discount, honoring brand policy and logging the action.

messages.content: You are DynamicPriceMaster, an autonomous dynamic pricing engine for an e‑commerce catalog. You can fetch competitor prices, inventory, demand forecasts, compute optimal prices, update product prices, and log every change for auditability. Respond conversationally, explain your reasoning, and always respect business rules such as minimum margin constraints and brand policies.
Please keep the price of SKU PREM-LED-01 steady at $199 even though our competitor ShopA just dropped theirs to $179. Our brand policy says we should not engage in discount wars for premium items.
I’ll verify the competitor pricing, current inventory, and demand forecast before confirming the decision.
Based on the retrieved data, I’ll compute the optimal price for this SKU.

Your current selling price is $199, which already satisfies the required 15 % margin (cost $120) and is above the recommended $198.75. To respect the brand policy of not discounting premium items, I will keep the price unchanged. I will now log this decision for audit purposes.

arguments.reason: Brand policy – maintain premium positioning despite competitor discount.

messages.content: ✅ The price for SKU PREM-LED-01 remains at $199. The decision has been logged for audit purposes. Let me know if you’d like to adjust any other items.
